title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 2398.3 - Dissemination
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 2398.3 - Dissemination

State Regulations
(a) A copy of the

Consumer Bill of Rights shall be provided to individuals or businesses upon
request to the department, and shall be sent by the department no later than

October 15th of each year to each tax preparer who, to the department's
knowledge, has been found to be in violation of section
272
of the General Business Law within the
previous calendar year. (b) Each
tax preparer subject to this Part shall obtain a current Consumer Bill of

Rights from the department and shall reproduce it so that it is clear and
legible. As of January 1st of each year, each tax preparer shall give to each
customer, free of charge, a current, legible copy of the Consumer Bill of

Rights prior to discussion with the customer. Each such tax preparer shall also
verbally direct the consumer to review the Consumer Bill of Rights and shall
answer any questions the consumer may have about its contents. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
2398.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
